title: Fillers in Spoken Language Understanding: Computational and Psycholinguistic Perspectives. (arXiv:2301.10761v4 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
abstract: Disfluencies (i.e. interruptions in the regular flow of speech), are ubiquitous to spoken discourse. Fillers ("uh", "um") are disfluencies that occur the most frequently compared to other kinds of disfluencies. Yet, to the best of our knowledge, there isn't a resource that brings together the research perspectives influencing Spoken Language Understanding (SLU) on these speech events. This aim of this article is to survey a breadth of perspectives in a holistic way; i.e. from considering underlying (psycho)linguistic theory, to their annotation and consideration in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) and SLU systems, to lastly, their study from a generation standpoint. This article aims to present the perspectives in an approachable way to the SLU and Conversational AI community, and discuss moving forward, what we believe are the trends and challenges in each area.

translated_title: 口语理解中的填充语：计算和心理语言学视角
translated_abstract: 给话语中的停顿打断（即说话流畅度不连续）是口头表达中普遍存在的现象。相比其他种类的停顿，填充语（“嗯”、“啊”）是最常见的。然而据我们所知，还没有一种资源将影响口语理解（SLU）对这些语音事件的研究视角汇聚在一起。本文的目的是以全面的方式调查各种视角，从考虑基础的（心理）语言学理论开始，到它们在自动语音识别（ASR）和SLU系统中的注释和考虑，最后从生成角度研究它们。本文旨在以可达到的方式向SLU和会话AI社区展示这些视角，并讨论前进时每个领域的趋势和挑战。
tldr: 本文综述了口语理解中填充语的研究视角，包括心理语言学理论、自动语音识别和SLU系统中的注释与考虑、以及生成角度的研究等，并探讨了每个领域的趋势和挑战。
en_tdlr: This article surveys the research perspectives on fillers in spoken language understanding, including underlying (psycho)linguistic theory, their annotation and consideration in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) and SLU systems, and their generation standpoint. The article discusses the trends and challenges in each area and presents them in an approachable manner to the SLU and Conversational AI community.
